page.title: 04BOMBS AT LA ROCQUE
page.content: My grandad remembers that it was the last Wednesday in June 1940 when the German planes arrived from Lessay in nearby France. They dropped 3 bombs in La Rocque. One landed on the slipway, another on the beach and the last one landed on the road. Three people died as a result. A Mr Pilkington got his foot blown off and was taken to hospital in St. Helier, where he died. As the planes swooped down, people ran into the tomato crops to hide. My grandad had left his handcart on the slipway at La Rocque. The bomb that landed on the slipway blew it to bits. When he returned he couldn't find even a splinter left.
